name: Renque Simulation Model
summary: Learn about .RNQ files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Researchers, engineers, and analysts use RNQ files to simulate and analyze system performance. In a DES model, systems are represented as sequences of events that occur at specific points in time.

DES model examples include a customer arriving at a service desk, a machine beginning a task, or an item being shipped. These simulations enable users to test various scenarios, identify bottlenecks, and inform data-driven decisions without impacting real-world operations.

description: An RNQ file contains a simulation model created with Renque, a discrete event simulation (DES) tool. It stores the complete setup of a simulation, including system components, event logic, timing rules, and data collection settings. RNQ files can represent a wide range of processes, including business operations, manufacturing systems, and service workflows.

instructions: You can open RNQ files with Renque Discrete Event Simulation software in Windows. The software can create, view, and run discrete event models. However, the program has been discontinued.
